tag.name: a subtle use of vocal harmony

wiki.content: Setting off with a slow-tempo romantic welcome, “Yellow Hearts” is a indie-music anthem that showcases a romantic relationship between two lovebirds and how “yellow hearts” represent the social media love coming from one of the lovers, through messages. On Genius Q&A (Question & Answer), Ant Saunders, himself, put down the main inspiration of the song in a small summary: "So this song was mainly inspired by this point in time where I was talking to this girl and she was interested at first and then after a while I just kept questioning if she still was or not. And it just had me so stressed out and freaking miserable. So the yellow hearts thing, there’s this one thing she would do where when we would Snapchat, whenever I would compliment her, she would send me like a bunch of yellow hearts." The song surprisingly blew up on social media app, TikTok with the audio being used in multiple-short clips. As well as mini-song duets, which covered the song. It is also known for Ant Saunders to produce and write the song himself. Asides from the song, this is the second track on his successful album "BUBBLE". "I actually produced the whole thing. I made the beat, I wrote it and everything. The first thing that came to me was the yellow hearts line. I usually make everything all at once, I write and produce at the same time. It’s definitely difficult to write and produce at the same time because it’s just hard to find different sounds that fit the vibe of your lyrics I guess. Sometimes I’ll just be bored and start making a beat. I’ll make a little section of the beat and then I’ll try to write around that. Or sometimes I’ll be bored and write a verse and then try to write a beat around that. I guess it’s easier to make a beat first because my writing process is really slow, but when I hear the beat, it is more of an inspiration. So I knew after that line I wanted to make something fun sounding, cause I felt like it fit that aesthetic or whatever. I was going for something fun and minimalistic. So my song blew up on TikTok. Not a lot of songs that went up on TikTok stick with people. They’re usually just kind of like a trend. They’re here and then they’re gone the next week. But it’s just really encouraging to me. People actually like my song. I made this all myself and people are just giving me like all kinds of support. It’s insane. The reception is like no other. I didn’t have a big following at all before the song took off, so I didn’t expect such a high caliber I guess in terms of streams and just people interacting with it." “Yellow Hearts” was certified gold by the RIAA on February 20, 2020.
